Reviews.Title: “Wow , what a location !!!”
Reviews.Author: travelerboba
Reviews.Content: Hotel is new , clean and comfortable. Can't get any closer to the World Trade Center Memorial. Free passes to memorial if you ask when booking .

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: suebart112
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last weekend, We THOUGHT we got a great rate of $159 on hotels.com. 2 reasons I would NOT recommend this place: Construction is going on all the time!! Woke up at 7am on Sunday to the lovely sounds of jackhammers. On Sunday?! Then today I noticed they charged my card an extra $43.67. When I called the hotel to find out why, they told me bc we checked out at 12:15; which is 15 minutes late. I know for a fact we ACTUALLY left our room at 11:55, but they said there is nothing they can do. For the lack of sleep we got and the price we wound up paying, I would have rather stayed in mid-town. 2 thumbs down!!

Reviews.Title: “A really comfortable hotel in an interesting location”
Reviews.Author: tapit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one overnight last weekend. The room was very comfortable and well- furnished. The bathroom was interesting- a little small and the shower was weird, but it worked properly. Our room overlooked the construction of the World Trade Center- you could see down into the hole from 10 years ago. An eerie feeling. The only mistake we made was taking the E train to the World Trade Center. Because of construction, it meant we had to walk around a lot, which was tough since I had hurt my leg. But- of you take the #1 or R or N trains to Rector St. you're only a few blocks away. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “very nice staff - big noise”
Reviews.Author: VacaJill
Reviews.Content: Good and bad. The staff is very friendly and interested in making guests happy. Be careful of room placement. Rooms on lower levels facing construction are unbearably loud. Rooms on higher floors are absolutely fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: bostonienne
Reviews.Content: Fun updated hotel with excellent service. My teenage daughter and I usually stay near Times Square but wanted to branch out. We were very pleased with this choice. I booked on Priceline then called the hotel the day before to request twin beds rather than the queen bed. They accommodated this request and also allowed us to check in at 1 PM instead of 3 PM. The room was fairly small but not cramped, and we found it very comfortable. We did hear the construction noise - my daughter slept right through it but if you're a light sleeper, some earplugs would be a good idea. The 20th floor restaurant offered a convenient and relaxing option for lunch on our first day, before heading out for our adventures. We enjoyed a marvelous soup, sandwich and crab cakes. An interesting perk is the option to borrow an ipad - they put a steep deposit on the credit card but we enjoyed having it available all weekend, to read reviews of the shows we saw and check maps and restaurant information. One other tip - for groceries or takeout meals, the Amish Market at 53 Park Place was quite amazing - it takes up an entire block and is about a 10 min. walk from this hotel. I recommend this hotel, especially for those who plan to visit the World Trade Center site.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4 start hotel”
Reviews.Author: adumala
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel we were generally excited, because this is not an area we typically stay in. Never mind it was a 4 start with a great price! All the construction made it difficult to get around (via walking or cab), we understand that this is not the hotels fault. Side note: from what we've seen the 9/11 memorial will be beautiful! However, upon our arrival one of us had gone in to check in while the other waited to see where we should park. After finding out that the parking garage was located across a busy intersection, we took the bags inside and to our surprise there was no door person/bell “hop or luggage rack. The woman at the front desk had to call someone to assist us and they brought a moving hand cart? Also, the beds were very uncomfortable, there was only 2 flimsy pillows in our room (we asked for more the 2nd night of our stay), they did have a coffee maker but there was only decaf available. The room was set up very odd; the bed placement and storage options were just undesirable. There was a fridge (empty for storage I’m assuming) but it wasn’t plugged in and because it was placed in a wall cubby we couldn’t see the plug? So whatever food we stored from dinner went bad anyway. The shower was awful, low pressure and not designed for comfort. AND don’t leave a few minutes past check-out time, or you will get a $35 charge added to your account. During my check out alone this not only happened to me but another couple. The best part of the hotel was complementary water bottle stations located in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price.”
Reviews.Author: tourist_from_Russia
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on March 9, 2012. It is not a 4 star hotel, but it is new, clean, and nice location. Rooms are very small, but very modern. Beds are comfortable. We did not hear any noise from the construction, the room was very dark and quiet. Nice view from the roof-top terrace. Breakfast is nothing special, but again the view was awesome. It was a good value for the money, and I would stay there again. Tip: if you need a babysitter in a hotel, try NY Nanny Finder they are great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect (small) space for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: GreenTravelerMA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is connected to the Club Quarters and although we booked a room at the World Center Hotel through Hotwire we were assigned a room at the Club Quarters. Although the hotels have two seperate lobbies they are connected on each floor and share common amenities. As is typical for Club Quarters the rooms are tiny but well appointed and very clean. You're not going to entertain friends in this room, but then again you didn't come to New York to hang out in the room, did you? The hotel location is perfect - across the street from the W Hotel and World Trade Center, and just a few blocks from the red line that takes you to Times Square. I also appreciated the hotel's environmental program as the building earned LEED Gold certification during construction but has also embraced a number of environmental friendly operations. For example the hotel has a centralized water purification system and provides free reusable water bottles for your travels across the city. This is great for the environment - and great for your wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mihaelanica
Reviews.Content: The bathroom, albeit modern, was far from sparkling! Maybe they have better rooms in the other half of the hotel, reserved to club quarters guests, but our room was small and dark(it faced other buildings) and, honestly, the shower could have used a scrub! The fitness room was nice, the bottled water free, and the location was great. We booked through Hotwire and the $156/night would have been a fair price if the hotel had been a real 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Lower Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: harvsibley
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this lower Manhattan hotel. Overlooks the WTC memorial and has incredible views of the new Freedom Tower. Due to local construction, rates are super and they include a free drink and ;free full breakfast. Its worth it just to have a drink on the floor and look out the glass walls at the WTC site.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms - Construction noise”
Reviews.Author: aimsea99
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, located in Financial District. Good service, we had a check-in at 11:00AM instead of 3:00PM; Green Hotel (environmental) Very good price for Manhattan hotel (112$ US +tx) Construction noise due to the 9/11 memorial site No Bedbugs

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience!”
Reviews.Author: taliabunting
Reviews.Content: The service here was fantastic. Loved staying here. The customer service was great which is the biggest plus for me. They let us check in early which sold me on this hotel for the rest of my visits to New York. I hate when a hotel is unhelpful just because of a useless policy. They had a room available to check into and this allowed us to start our adventure early instead of having to cart around our luggage. There is construction going on as they rebuild, so the hotel gave us complimentary drinks. The construction wasn't too bothersome. The bottled water in the halls was so convenient also.

Reviews.Title: “Room is freezing, no one is serving, and space is too little.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff Y
Reviews.Content: 1. The heater was not on when we got into the room. I know it is "environmental", but it took 12 hours for us to feel warm again, before that, it was FREEZING in the room! Seriously, freezing. 2. No one is serving, i understand it is "auto check in", but the guy at the front desk didn't care about us at all. We looked stupid there and waiting for him to talk to us. 3. The room is too small, I have stayed in tens of "4-start hotel", this room was the SMALLEST I have ever stayed. BTW, the priceline rated this hotel as 3.5-star, definitely not 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Descent, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: srdjan s
Reviews.Content: location was really good. close proximity to several metro stations. we asked right in the beginning to change our room that overlooked the wtc construction site due to reviews concerning noise coming from that direction. receptionist did everying in accordance with our request however new room was completely surrounded by other buildings next to the hotel. we had serious difficulties even with mobile signal. despite that, room was comfortable and clean, especially bathroom (we always pay special attention to that particular detail). Some of the guest made serious noise during several nights. I had a feeling that stayed in a dorm instead of hotel. Breakfast room at the top of the hotel provides excellent views.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business”
Reviews.Author: jrbasso
Reviews.Content: I went as tourist to NY and I was in this hotel. The rooms is good, clean, very good service. The restaurant in the hotel is expensive, but the view is nice. Be aware that this hotel is the same street of the world trade center construction. They work from 6 am thru 10:30 pm. So, as tourist it is ok, but terrible to sleep. The subway is close, starbuck in one block.

Reviews.Title: “Worth”
Reviews.Author: Danicaetanooo
Reviews.Content: Good! Clean, and comfy. The shower is the best that I've ever tried. Friendly and happy staff. A lot of places to eat around the hotel. A safe area to stay. In the most simple room it has fridge, microwave, coffee-maker and hair-dryer. They offer free bottles of water in the 3rd floor!! It is about a 20 minute subway ride from Times Square. I definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in NY”
Reviews.Author: AshleyKA
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom were new and modern. We had a room that overlooked Ground Zero, so we had a great view. We didn't have any issues with noise, but we stayed over New Years and the construction workers were not working several of the days we were there. The location of the hotel is perfect with many subway stops very nearby. The area around the hotel was really busy during the day but much calmer at night. It was kind of a nice break from the hustle and bustle of other areas of the city. And the free bottled water in the hallway was a lifesaver on more than one occasion!

Reviews.Title: “Sort of ok, I guess”
Reviews.Author: Sarah D
Reviews.Content: The bathrooms were nice but the rooms felt a little sterile. Maybe it was the lighting, maybe it was the furniture, but the rooms felt like ones you would get at a high-end drug rehab center. A rehab center for the stars, if you will. I think it was the "green" initiative that the hotel had going which created this vibe. I never thought I'd care about hotel room lighting, yet here I am. The ground zero contruction was not that bad and our window was practically pressed against it. The construction outside was soothing compared to the what sounded like Santa Claus getting a head start on some furniture making for next year in one of the nearby rooms. Every morning around 6:30am, bang, bang, bang, bang from within the hotel, not outside. The housekeeping staff and folks in the restaurant were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay...but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: twinmommyof2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a weekend in early December. This property is directly against ground zero. Nice hotel, rooms are spacious and the decor is very Ikea like. It was about a 20 minute subway ride from times square area. When we checked in, our room was directly overlooking all the construction and it was VERY loud. We thought we would ask if there was a quieter room and were given another one right away. This time it faced the courtyard. It was very quiet but the trade off is no view of anything but a wall. That was fine with us. Area felt safe at night walking to and from the subway. Restaurant had a good view of the reflecting pools at ground zero, should be a fantastic view once it is all complete. The food was good and reasonably priced. Loved happy hour! My only complaint would be about the elevators...you can basically only access your floor and the restaurant and need your room key to do so. I realize that this is a security feature and think it's a great idea. The problem was that we had other parties staying on other floors and were unable to stop the elevator on their floors. Took us a day or so to figure out that the front desk could add those floors to your room card would have been nice if they had suggested it. For the price we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: EuropeTraveler3400
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel...especially if you work in the Financial District and need to stay close. The hotel had okay customer service (not overly friendly, nor overly rude). Found the rooms to be nice and spacious (although it looks as if my room was larger than the norm). Breakfast at the restaurant was good. Place does get loud because of WTC construction. It did quiet down though from about 9pm-6am.

Reviews.Title: “Not the cheapest but a great quality/price ratio ! loved it :-)”
Reviews.Author: Lebinbrussels
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Cheaper than most of the other NYC with the same amenities, standards and location. i was there in June 2011. While the works were ongoing in the nearby WTC site, i couldn't hear anything. i Choose a room not overlooking the WTC site, so maybe this is why. i also was out during the day, and no works took place in the evening. now i think the works must be over. loved the free fresh water distributer on each floor. Very nice rooms, clean and modern. Very close to the subway (1 block away, 5 mins walk), you should know that it is in the downtown /soho area in the most southern part of Manhattan, so it will be like a 15-20 minutes subway trip to times square (central manhattan). The area near the hotel is very nice, with lots of restaurants, snacks, bars, and full of other hotels. very close to wall street, the south ferry station where you can take the free ferry to staten island, and to the trinity church.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: linclark76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a new Hotel and is right next to Ground Zero. In fact our room looked over on to Ground Zero. Although there is a huge building site next to the hotel, we did not hear any noise and the building was going on in to the night (don't let this put you off). When we checked in we were given a letter offering a free drink during our stay. The bar is located on the 20th floor and is well worth a visit just for the view. Our room was spacious and clean with a kitchenette. We had breakfast up on the 20th and the food was excellent with a very good choice. The Hotel is in a good location for exploring Lower Manhattan. We spent 2 nights here after sending 2 nights at The W Hotel on Lexington Ave Midtown. The World Center Hotel is by far a better Hotel. I highly recommend this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: malatestiano
Reviews.Content: Pros: Hotel is very clean and Staff is very helpful. Rooms are very new, Rooftop Terrace restaurant has a super view on 9/11 Memorial. Price is very low for NYC standards. South Seaport TKTS locations is within walking distance. Several Subway stations are within a few blocks. Cons: Hotel is so close to 9/11 Memorial/Ground Zero that the construction noise (24/7) can be very annoying (I have the idea that once the construction ends, prices per room will skyrocket...). Location is far from everything of interest in NYC, but as stated above subway stations are very close by...

Reviews.Title: “Not luxury, but good enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: nxf83
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire and were disappointed to learn that the price we paid was only about $10 cheaper than what the hotel normally charges. The hotel itself was fine. The staff were great, but the rooms were very basic. Others complained about the location, but I thought it was fine. The area is REALLY quiet at night, but it's close to several subway lines and is easy to get around. If you're with people, the area is fine, but it gets really dark and quiet in the evenings, and I didn't feel comfortable walking alone at night. There are a few restaurants nearby, though nothing is open late. I found myself going to Sam's Falafel stand for several meals, which was excellent and cheap for a generous portion. I didn't try any of the hotel's food, but the free coffee out of the machine in the lobby is far better than what they give you in the room. The staff were very nice and let us check in early at no extra charge. When we saw our room and decided we didn't want the Ground Zero view and construction noise, they were very accommodating about changing our room to a higher floor and different side, and upgraded us to one of their Club Quarters rooms. The room itself was bare bones, even after the upgrade. It was tiny, even smaller than I was expecting for New York, and the bed and small desk took up most of the space in the room. Basically, it's the kind of hotel where you just go back to sleep after a long day of sightseeing, because the room feels very cramped when you're awake, even with just two people.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, boring location”
Reviews.Author: TH3R
Reviews.Content: LOCATION - the worst part of this hotel stay. it's close to nothing really, except wall street and maybe the pier to the statue of liberty. walking distance to nothing fun/interesting. we wanted SOHO, but priceline's "area" map was "SOHO/Financial district". so of course for our bidding price, we only got the financial district. this hotel and area is NOT close to SOHO at all. maybe a 30-45 minute walk to SOHO. STAFF - average staff. they weren't rude, but they weren't the friendliest either. just average. ROOMS - decent sized rooms. clean and comfortable. bed was fine, and they had an iPod/iPhone alarm docking station. bathroom was fine also. ROOFTOP - nice area to hang out and see the view of the city, although it's not that tall, so there are plenty of other skyscrapers obstructing your view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: akkrn1979
Reviews.Content: We took a girls vacation at stayed at the World Center Hotel. This place is a hidden gem in NYC! Everyone was very professional and accommodating. We had a one bedroom suite, which was very spacious and modern, especially by NYC standards. The kitchen and bath area were modern and clean. We were able to sleep two in the queen bed and one (but I think two would be fine) on the pull out sofa. My friend said the pull-out was the most comfortable she has ever slept on. Our room faced the world-trade site, but we didn't feel that noise was a problem. We took the opportunity to have a drink in the hotel bar/restaurant, and were very glad that we did. There was outdoor seating (in October), so you could see the NYC skyline. The night time views of the world trade center site were breathtaking. Some of our favorite photos of New York were taken here (and the price of drinks was reasonable as well!) The location of the hotel is about 1 1/2 blocks from the red and yellow sub line, both are very easy to locate. There are also a lot of little coffee shops and restaurants near by. I would recommend to anyone to stay here for a more affordable hotel and sub it in to Times square or where ever you want to go. It was definitely worth the savings and the accommodations are much better than most of the places in Mid-town !! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “No light when you walk inside the room!”
Reviews.Author: charlot
Reviews.Content: We went to vist family last year for Christmas stayed three nights. Check in went well, was surprised how nice the front desk was. The room had a king bed which made it tight, but this is NY. Happy that the bathroom & sheets on the bed were clean. I wanted to put the clothes away in the drawers inside a closet, so I searched for a light, and did not find one. I thought it was strange not having a light when you enter the room. We took two cabs and my husband had to navigate them to the hotel, so they got no tip. The subway and the WTC memorial are within walking distance. Tried the restaurant for breakfast and for the price & quality of food I would pass.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and new hotel, exceptional costumer service, great location”
Reviews.Author: topjur01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great choice and we will surely return. Firstly, it is new which is rare in Manhattan. Rooms and hallways are shiny and clean. Secondly, the location is great. Metro stations are around the corner and they take you everywhere. We took a superior room and it was large, cozy and clean. It had microwave and fridge. There is a stereo where you can put in your music with iPod or iPhone, which is very useful. Free wireless internet in hotel rooms and computers in the lobby. The costumer service was exceptional. We had some requests after our arrival and the hotel dealt with them quickly and professionally. The breakfast restaurant is fancy and the views from the restaurant are spectacular. Other toursts wait in long lines to see WTC and you get to see it from above while eating breakfast. Most of the guests are businessmen. I read some comments about the noise from the construction site. Well, Manhattan is not a quiet place. Here you get noise from the construction, in Soho or around Times Square you would get noise from traffic, in Chelsea you get noise from nightlife. If you want a quiet place, you need to go to the suburbs. Unfortunatelly pets are not allowed in the hotel. Definitely we will consider this hotel on our next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but otherwise, great.”
Reviews.Author: mmcdivitt
Reviews.Content: We went into it knowing that there would be a lot of noise from the construction. We were under the impression that construction lasted from 6am to 11pm however the construction was 24 hours during our stay. We had a good view of the 9/11 Memorial and One World Center (under construction). The location was great. It's close to the attractions in Lower Manhattan and is a short subway ride to everywhere else. The rooms were very clean, bed was comfortable and room service was wonderful. We ate at the restaurant once and that left a bit to be desired. The quality of food and service was not what you'd expect when you're paying that kind of price. If you stay here and are a light sleeper, I highly recommend you bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is wonderful but avoid the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: CherrieN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and was very happy with the hotel. Perfect location, loved our room, and friendly people behind the desk. We enjoyed watching the construction and the noise did not bother us at all. You got to watch history being built. I would definitely stay there again. The only negative was the restaurant. We ate breakfast there once and dinner once and then would never go again. The service at the restaurant was horrible and I'm really not a picky person. But I had to ask for both of my coffee refills and our waiter never checked on us again at dinner after we got our meal. I think it's because they added their tip to the check before it's given to people so why bother to have to do a good job. It's a great location and view so if they fired the manager and hired someone to manage it, it could likely do great. There's several little breakfast diners and a Starbucks within a block or two and other restaurants for dinner so I wouldn't avoid the hotel b/c of the restaurant. Other than the restaurant, the rest of the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: bfriedman68
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at the World Center hotel but found excuses not to stay there; normally building by point base with the national chains. That ends with my first of many visits to this hotel. The check in experience was a little different because room selection is random based on a check in kiask; not bad just different. The room was excellent, it was large and I dont mean large by NY standards I mean large by normal standards. My room had a large balconey that overlooked the construction at Ground Zero. Even though the construction is going on around the clock the sound did not penatrate the room. I stay in hotels nationally about 200+ nights a year and am normally unimpressed with the food; I had an opportunity to eat twice at the roof top resturant and the food was amazing, the brick chicken was perfect.The view from the restaurant is spectacular and allows you to see the reflecting pools from a view not shared elsewhere. The only drawl back was catching a taxi; that is also dictated by the location because the street it is located on is also the enterance to the memorial. The W is diaginal across the street and is a quick solution to this dilema. I highly recommend this hotel and it will be my hotel of choice for my monthly NY visits.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel if you know NYC”
Reviews.Author: AussieNat24
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel - perfect for exploring the city.. Not great if you want to be in the 'thick' of things of the city (it's almost a $17 cab ride from Macy's ) but the service is amazing in the hotel, rooms are great with fabulous facilities - even the sofa bed is comfortable! The restaurant overlooks the new memorial so we didn't have to go and see it, as you can see it from above.. Free wifi - always a plus especially since it is everywhere in the hotel. Final point - due to the location and the works going on, there is some noise throughout the night and morning but you get used to it... And there are not too many restaurants in the district Would definitely book again at our next stay...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But......”
Reviews.Author: LadyPearl47
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through Priceline and so I can't complain about the price, but if I had paid full price I would have been even more disappointed. The good: Great location, free internet, chilled water station on each floor. The rooms are clean and new. The bad or needs improvement: This hotel emphasizes "green" but what they give is "spartan". First off, I was given a room with twin beds. My child sized bed was hard as stone, and combined with the micro size room and total lack of comfort or amenites, I felt like I was immured in a monk's cell. I am an average weight person and 5'4" tall, but I was cramped in this bed. I can't even begin to imagine someone 6' tall trying to sleep in that bed. For a supposed four star hotel, the amenities in the bath were also spartan; mouthwash, shampoo, lotion. That's it. Not even kleenex. There were tissues in the room, and if you need one while you're in the bathroom, you have to step out there to get one. The bar and restaurant close very early and there's no minibar in the room but there was an empty refrigerator, a microwave and a coffee maker. There was a empty padded hangar in the closet that was probably meant for a bathrobe...which was not provided in my case though it would have been a welcome and not unexpected amenity in an upscale hotel. The halls are set up like a maze and gave the impression that the hotel rooms were built pre-fab somewhere else, brought fully assembled to the site, and stacked up like legos on each floor. At the end of my three night stay, I felt like I had couch surfed on someone's sofa, which is not how you should feel after staying in an "upscale" hotel. There is definitely room for improvement here.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Attitude Was Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Stacy M
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying that the hotel was in a wonderful location, especially for visiting the 9/11 Memorial. The room was clean and a good size, though the hallways were a bit maze-like and the elevator was painfully slow at times. Overall, the hotel's skeleton is a 5/5. Unfortunately, the staff ruined my experience of the hotel, thus dropping it to a 2/5. My partner and I stayed at this location in October 2011, and were headed to Boston on the Amtrak the following day to watch an NFL game. We had plans to come back to NYC the day after and then stay with family in a NY suburb, thus no longer needing a hotel. I had phoned the hotel prior to our trip to ask if luggage storage was available, explaining the situation (We were unable to take our larger luggage on the train, as no checked baggage was allowed). The person I spoke to on the phone noted that it wouldn't be a problem. Pleased, I didn't make a Plan B. I should have. After we returned to World Center Hotel after spending the evening sight-seeing, I decided to double check on the luggage storage prior to heading to sleep, and the individual I spoke to explained to me in a rather blunt, rather impatient tone that I could NOT store my luggage unless I had a future reservation. This was the hotel's policy and he followed hotel policy. When I asked if he knew other locations where I could store my luggage, or if storage was available at Amtrak, he said "no" in a dismissive fashion. Since I could tell he wouldn't be of any use, I left to go flush out a plan B, at nearly 2AM (when we had to be up at 6AM to get to the train). Luckily for me, a very kind man at Amtrak's phone line informed me that it does have luggage storage for its passengers, for a mere $4.50/bag. It wasn't the hotel policy that bothered me, or even the fact that the person I spoke to on the phone and this other hotel personnel had different stories. It was the complete lack of caring or assistance from the person running the front desk. The following morning, the same individual was working. I asked if he could get my partner and I a taxi. Again, I received a dismissive 'no'. He briefly elaborated that it would be quicker for me to catch a cab around the corner, which no doubt it was. However, his manner of informing me of this was completely inappropriate. Had he said "I could, but actually there are usually a number of cabs just on the opposite side of the building. Please come back and I'll phone a company for you if there aren't any", then I would have forgiven his earlier behavior, and maybe the hotel would have reached 4/5 potential. We were the only persons in the lobby during each occasion, so I can't excuse his behavior by saying "oh, it was just busy". We should have received 4 star treatment, and it was pretty much no star treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel at Ground Zero”
Reviews.Author: CanadaJordan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during the 911/ 10 year memorial. This is a new facility and it's simply wonderful. Yes some of the rooms are smal like mine but yet very spacious and provided all that you needed- large closet, stunning washroom and free wifi. My room however was on the North side and when I looked out my window I saw into Ground zero and the men still working hard. It takes you back and makes you reflect. Being in NY for the 911 memorial the security and media was crazy, but yet the staff were still amazing and so helpful. Thanks for all the help and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mikrin
Reviews.Content: Our stay was late September 2011. This is a new hotel, adjacent to the 9-11 Memorial. The hotel is spotless, offers free water and cookies in the evening. Location is perfect, prices are reasonable. We are so glad we stayed there, it could not have been any better. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel overlooking the building of The World Trade Center Towers”
Reviews.Author: dcslatts
Reviews.Content: Be aware that if you get a room facing North, you overlook "Ground Zero" and the construction of the new World Trade Center Towers. Normally that would be a bad thing, especially since work goes on 24 hours a day during the week. But at this location you have to appreciate and marvel at the rebirth of an American Landmark. It's fascinating and cathartic to see the progress. And the soundproofing of the rooms is very good. As for the hotel itself, I couldn't be happier with it. It definitely has an efficient European feel as the hallways and rooms are somewhat small, but I don't feel cheated. Each floor has free filtered water to fill your walk-around bottle. There is free Wifi with a good signal throughout the building. The lobby has computers and a printer without charge. The superb team that runs the hotel is always happy to help. There is one restaurant and bar on the 20th floor and it has seating inside and out on a patio with great views. The food is wonderful and for Manhattan, the prices are very reasonable. (No $23 bowls of Oatmeal for breakfast here.) If you want very large rooms with overpriced restaurants and charges for every extra this is not your place. But if you're looking for a modern, clean hotel in downtown Manhattan that treats you well you can't go wrong here. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, roomy, well located and comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: IHeartTravelling2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the World Center Hotel for four nights, 22 SEP 11 - 26 SEP 11, and found it clean and comfortable. I had a large room - 513 - that was handicap accessible. Completely comfy bed and loved the floor to ceiling windows. Lots of storage. Blackout curtains definitely did their job. Yes, there was construction 18-hours per day (6AM to midnight), but I was awake until midnight every night anyway and the 6AM start was no biggie. Late night (3AM and 4AM) guests coming back to the hotel noise was the most challenging aspect of my stay, two different groups of boozy women on two different nights. Maybe ask for a room away from the water station on each floor as that was a linger point for all the chatty late night guests. The location of the hotel is superb with subway access to 1, 9; A, C, E; 4, 5, 6 all within short walking distance. Personally I loved the convenient location and spent a gorgeous morning in Battery Park City on the waterfront overlooking the Statue of Liberty. One thing I thought was funny was that Club Quarters and World Center hotels are the same building, but no one seems to mention that in their reviews. Go with whichever hotel costs less per night. Nice feature: Being able to print my airline boarding pass in the lobby on the day of my flight. Would definitely stay at the World Center hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ROGER D
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in late september.Rooms can be small but have everything you need and you dont go to new york to sit in your room.The location is great all the following are walkable,brooklyn bridge,statton island ferry,ellis island ferry,helicopter flights,nypd museum,fdny museum and you are on the door step for the wtc.go and have breakfast on the 20th floor of the hotel and have a fantastic view over the site.Plenty of subway stations close to the hotel and for the ladies century 21 shop is 5 minutes away.we would stay again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good but requires earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: Brian A
Reviews.Content: Ongoing work around WTC makes it a little bit awkward to get to some subway stations, but otherwise great location - reasonable walking distance to Wall Street, and other south manhattan landmarks. Room facilities were good, and the room was clean and tidy. Although self-service checkin was available, receptionist was available and did it for us - quick, easy and courteous. Brilliant view into ground zero site and the memorial pools. Only downside, work was ongoing 24/7, with lots of noise even late at night. Heavy drilling stopped around 11pm, but noise never stopped.

Reviews.Title: “The forgotten laptop!”
Reviews.Author: Excellentlocation
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days in August with my family and we were evacuated due to Hurricane Irene. My twenty year old son forgot his laptop in his room and only realized this once we were back home in Ottawa on Saturday. The hotel was closed until Monday due to the hurricane and when we called we were told that they had the laptop and returned it via FedEx. We received it a couple of days later. HOW GREAT IS THAT HOTEL! A BIG THANKS TO THE STAFF!

Reviews.Title: “Excellet Hotel and great shopping close by”
Reviews.Author: Morten S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the World Center Hotel for 5 night. Nice large rooms and great location in Low End. If you don't stay in Low End you might miss out on some great places like Battery Park, southern bay area and Department store 21th Century Outlet... EXCELLENT!!! If you don't want to spend a whole lot (NY prices) on a nice hotel this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk tried to ignore details of my reservation”
Reviews.Author: SoloWoman_10
Reviews.Content: Planned my hotel through Expedia and knew I was scheduled to have a "premium room, upper floor, kitchenette, and over-looking the World Trade Center Memorial Site." This was very important, as visiting the memorial was the purpose of my trip to NY. I even went to the expense of phoning the hotel, the night before I departed Toronto, to ensure my reservation details were "in order." Imagine my shock, on checking in, the desk personnel tried to put me in a 2nd floor on the opposite side of the hotel. After emphatically saying "no way!" did the desk person change my room to what was outlined in my reservation and my phone confirmation - including the fact I was on the 15th floor, not the 2nd. I would like to say that this was the end of my problems, but although I hung a "do not disturb" sign on my door, I was awaken by the telephone ringing early the next morning. Being hearing impaired, and unable to make out what is being said on the telephone, I had to dress and drag myself down to the desk to find out what they wanted. Apparently, there was a food delivery - in error - and they did not check the name of the room occupant before phoning me. They apologized. On my last morning, I decided to treat myself to a buffet breakfast in their 20th floor restaurant. After being assigned to a table, although the person near the door acted almost horrified that I would be sitting alone. There were no plates near the hot buffet food - had to ask for one. Sausages, in the steamer tray, looked raw and were taken away by someone from the kitchen when I pointed them out. My waiter was rushing around like a "chicken with its head cut off" and not accomplishing much. I brought my food to the table, but didn't get silverware, napkin, or coffee cup until I went up to the counter to ask for them. By that time, my food was cold and decided to just get a new plate. Had to return to the counter to ask for more coffee - even though there was a waiter pouring coffee at the table next to mine and did did not even look my way. **Another solo-diner woman, near me, was having the same problems. On the previous morning, I asked the lobby desk to arrange for a car (for 5 pm) to take me to the airport the next day. They quoted a flat-rate charge (no extra taxes, etc.) that I would pay the driver. I reconfirmed the time and price, with the desk, when I checked out. The car was on time, but when I got to the airport, the driver said the price was higher than what the hotel quoted. I decided to not pay the higher rate. Other than all these problems, my stay in NY was wonderful and will return for another trip. However, I will stay at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, GREAT price, ok location.”
Reviews.Author: m005534
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for an amazing price....without bed bugs (I thoroughly checked the room!). If you want an affordable room in a safe neighborhood in Manhattan this is the place for you. Walking distance to Battery Park and Wall Street. For a quiet night sleep ask to be placed on the opposite side of the WTC construction. You can still go to the roof to take pics of it, along with having a glass of wine/dinner without having to listen to the noise throughout the night. The only negative thing about the location is that the subway doesn't run very late on the weekends to the financial district so unless you plan to be back early on Sat/Sun you'll have to take a cab back. Bonus: the hotel has a work center to check email and print things out (boarding passes, etc) for free with apples in the lobby for a quick breakfast on the go! Also, the food pamphlet in the room has a great sushi place in it that delivers to the hotel for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “It is a distance from Times square”
Reviews.Author: Dillboy
Reviews.Content: Our room looked over the WTC construction site. Jack hammers woke us up at 7am which was fine for me as I was there for business. We had a great view on the top of the hotel and the room was clean, and good for our drop and go stay. There was FREE water bottles to Fill on each Floor!!! so that saved us $$$ each day as it was hot in August Poor location if you want to be in time square but great location of you do not want to pay $$$ in times square. We took the sub direct from Grand central to right near the hotel and then did the same where ever we wanted to go (like a true New Yorker would).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: herekittyOhio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over an extended Labor Day weekend. We chose WC because of the price and the location. We wanted to "do" Lower Manhatten on this visit to NYC. The only up- downside is that it is very near Ground Zero. The upside is the very location and talking to the locals and businesses which were involved in the 9-11 attacks. Some pretty heart wenching stories. The downside is that it is right next to the construction and it's noisy. We simply asked if there was a quieter room and were moved immediately to the other side of the hotel. We went to the theater one evening and had our first experience riding the subway. Very convenient, but if you want the hustle and bustle of Times Square and midtown, you should look elsewhere since it's probably 4 miles up to that area. The hotel is clean, modern and the staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “World Center Hotel - A bunch of Weasels”
Reviews.Author: Peter Y
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. The staff extremely useless. We were here when hurricane Irene hits. The hotel management weasels their way out of the responsiblilty to help us locate another hotels while the stupid manor evacuated lower manhattan to weasel out of any liability. There are probably more people died because of the evacuation than because of the hurricane. We have extensively travelled around the wordl, this hotel is poorly managed and a 3.5 stars max. Strongly recommend to stay in W-Hotel across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....would stay again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenbazweb
Reviews.Content: C'mon people, if your looking for quiet, don't go to New York City! Our room DID face the Trade Center construction site but it was WORTH it! A very emotional and awesome sight to see, for sure! Noise wasn't THAT bad! Room was very clean and comfy! Price was GREAT! Subway right around corner, Statue of Liberty (boat to her) is walking distance (get there early). Helpful employees! Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Grows on you.”
Reviews.Author: jsch3
Reviews.Content: At check in, I had low expectations. There was a small lobby; hardly what you would expect of a four star hotel. Rather, it was similar to an apartment or extended stay hotel. Check in was handled by one of those automated check-in kiosks which never seem to work so a very courteous and friendly agent completed my check-in and gave me a high floor as requested. The room was a bit small but had everything you would need. The furniture did not seem to be built to high standards and the upholstered chair was already fraying. The room was very clean. The filtered water is a nice touch as was the free internet. The construction noise is a problem so if you are a light sleeper, look elsewhere. Otherwise, its a nice choice.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, good location, and ok value”
Reviews.Author: kmcf1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in July 2011. It was easy to find the hotel, which is directly beside the World Trade Center site. We were worried about the construction noise that everyone complains about, but the room we were given was on the 4th floor, towards the back and looking out onto a (very dark) atrium so it was totally peaceful. It is pretty basic. Our room was a studio kitchenette-type room, so the room was really small, and the bed was actually a converted sofa-bed. I thought it'd be dreadful, but I got really great sleep there- I didn't want to get out of bed! The pillows were also very comfortable. I liked the iPod station thing too. The bathroom was clean, etc- nothing wrong there and as you'd expect/hope. Note that the bath towels are stored under the sink- we didn't see them at first! We didn't eat here, as the reviews were not good. We also didn't interact much with the staff as check-in and -out were automated, but whenever we did they were very pleasant and courteous. They will also hold your luggage securely for the day when you check out, which is great. Good points: Due to the construction noise, they 'compensated' us by giving a letter offering a free drink at the bar on the 20th floor. You could easily miss this letter, so watch out for it in the room!!! The lady that served us at the bar was very nice. The view from the bar is interesting, and definitely worth a look. Nice place to go at sunset, for a pre-dinner drink. That was a highlight. The water dispensers on each floor are a great idea. It was really hot and humid in NY during our trip, so this was brilliant as we could grab a water on the way out. Actually, we didn't really find anything wrong with the hotel, as a basic place to sleep well that is very clean and in a good location. I'll certainly check the price when I go back to NY. Bad points: You couldn't tell what the weather was like unless you went up to the window and looked up at the sky. For a cheap (-ish) place to stay in NY, it's fine. You're not really in the room anyway - only at night - so who cares?

Reviews.Title: “Loved the convenience and ease”
Reviews.Author: lanekim
Reviews.Content: Everything from check in to check out flowed smoothly. We were able to check in 2 hours early. Room was functional, spacious, clean and did not face the WTC construction, so we couldn't hear any noise. The pillows on the bed were extremely comfortable to the point where we wished we could take them home :) There are also bottled water stations on each floor, which was extremely convenient for trekking around the city in the hot weather. The hotel is close to major subway lines so it's easy to navigate to other areas without having to rely on cabs. (I highly recommend buying the 7-day unlimited MetroCard if you plan on using the subway most of the time). It is directly across from the WTC site and close to the Financial District. Also, if you're flying in/out from the NJ/Newark Airport, then this hotel is perfect because it's so close to the PATH system which takes you to NJ where you can then take NJ transit to the airport and ride the Airtrain to your terminal (save yourself the cab fare!). The concierge was also very friendly and knowledgeable about NYC, so don't be afraid to ask questions. They were also able to hold our bags for us even after check out so that we had more time to check out some sites and didn't have to lug them around. The lobby is also convenient - comfortable seating, two computers with a printer available 24/7, restrooms and a TV. Overall, no complaints about this hotel! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, if you are willing to put up with a few things”
Reviews.Author: VD0623
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the World Center Hotel with our infant son for 3 nights during July. Here is what we thought: Pros -Very new and clean. Rooms are also fairly spacious by Manhattan standards. -Free to use laundry machines available, which comes in very handy when traveling with young children. -Complimentary filtered water with bottles to fill up at every floor. -Hotel has cribs available for infants -Free Wifi access -Can get a good deal, most likely because of the ongoing construction at Ground Zero. Cons -Since it is located right across from Ground Zero, construction can get loud. It is ongoing from 6am to 11pm, Mon - Sat. During most of our stay, the noise was tolerable, but on the last day, it got really loud even with the heavy duty windows fully shut. -Located in lower Manhattan, the area is not happening (besides construction). Luckily, the subway is a few blocks away (though the subway is not stroller or handicap friendly at all). -Taxi drivers usually do not know where it is located. We usually just told them to drop us off at the nearby W Hotel. -If you care about showering experience, the water flow is very weak (I think they are one of those 'Green' hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would love to return”
Reviews.Author: miss_edith
Reviews.Content: I booked a very cheap rate for the Club Quarters hotel and on check in was allocated a room in the World Centre part of the bulding instead. The room was on a high floor overlooking the building site and downtown. We had 2 double beds, a comfy chair and coffee table, a desk, fridge and microwave. The room was plenty big enough for a weeks stay and actually much nicer than a room we had at the Hyatt a few years ago. The noise from the building site didn't affect us but maybe that was because we were on a high floor. The free bottled water, coffee, cocktail on the roof and computers to use were great, nice little added extras. All the staff we encountered were friendly and efficient. I'd definitley return to this hotel and would be happy to pay a higher rate for it.

Reviews.Title: “Small Modern Rooms”
Reviews.Author: aliwishes
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but very modern and clean. They offer free wifi and free filtered drinking water (you fill plastic bottles yourself in the hall way) which is a nice touch. It is kind of noisy though since it is right next to the construction. But it didn't really bother me, kind of like white noise. Bring ear plugs though if you don't like construction noise. For what we paid though it was a really good value.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL AMAZING STAY AMAZING LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fiveomom7945
Reviews.Content: Ok so my daughter and I try to visit NYC once a year. We have stayed at MANY MANY hotels all across the city.. THANK GOD I FOUND WORLD CENTER HOTEL!! So I book the room in advance on their website. The Hotel is smack dab in front of Ground Zero( or as I call it GROUND HERO) I knew ahead of time that the rebuilding of that area is non stop, therefore most likely it would be noisy .. I didn't care .. Honestly Noise and NYC go hand in hand AND They are building history in the making before my eyes so I don't care about the noise. We get to the hotel and the lobby is SPOTLESS.. nice and cool on that SUPER HOT HOT DAY.. check in was a breeze!! The employees were so nice and so accommodating. They put us in a great room on the 17th floor(1705) with a view of ground zero. To my surprise It was not that noisy at all in the room! The windows and door are solid. The room had one area for the bed and nightstand and you walk towards the back of the room into a sitting area with a desk and pull out couch! There is a door you can open but there is no balcony or anything. When I opened the door then I can hear the noise! But what joyful noise it was.. People hard at work rebuilding a beautiful sacred site. The bathroom was a decent size. The room was MODERN AND CLEAN!!! I will say the one downfall is that it's a green hotel (which is great) BUT the air conditioner goes off when you leave the room and only turns back on when you come back in the room.. SO after being in the NYC heat all day we came back to a warm room. But once inside for a little it cools down:) We ate at the restaurant on the 20th floor it too had a great view.. Great service good prices. I honestly cannot find a bad thing to say about this hotel. The hotel is not in the " middle of all the action", that's true... but you take the train at Rector street and it takes you to any stop you want along the way in a matter of minutes!! The hotel is close to Battery Park which is where the ferry's for the Statue of Liberty are so that's great:) Another perk is in the hallways they have a chilled water machine with bottles that you can take and fill up with water! Bottled water for free:) Once again sorry for babbling but I WILL be back and stay here EVERY TIME I COME BACK TO NYC!! THANK YOU WORLD CENTER HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Loud, surly, and smelly.”
Reviews.Author: Tippin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just like NYC - loud, surly, and it really doesn't want you around. The first thing you should realize is that it is overlooking the WTC construction site, which is under construction 24 hours a day. Don't expect a quiet, relaxing stay - my advice is to drink, and drink a lot. So much that you simply pass out into a deep joyous drunken stupor and the noise goes away. The next thing you should know is that the staff does their best to give you the full NYC treatment, complete with grouchy "you're a PITA" attitude. It took 3 tries before I got to a tolerable room (room #1: 2nd floor with 200db jackhammer audio bonus. room #2: dirty smoker room. room #3 twin kiddie room - stayed there), but the rock hard mattress, sink that wouldn't drain, and faucet with the hot/cold indicators reversed solidified my intense dislike of this property. Oh, and they need some dang signs to tell people about the self-checkin kiosks so we don't stand around for 15 min while the one front desk worker tries to fix the printer for another guest. I'd recommend skipping out on this beauty, and realizing that new doesn't necessarily equal good.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, stuck next to a huge construction site”
Reviews.Author: PGilchrist
Reviews.Content: This place does the job, its clean, has everything you could need, the staff were friendly. The room is a little smallish but you're in NYC, the rooms only for sleeping. Everything else is state of the art. That being said it is next to the new WTC site. It is noisy! They worked until midnight and started again at 6am. They offer you a free drink and have a lot of interesting information in the room to explain what is going on, but its certainly loud. I'll be back. People should support this area and this hotel, far superior to the Times Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean good value small hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluevalor
Reviews.Content: Clean small business hotel with only double bed next to windows with view of downtown nyc. Inexpensive, friendly staff and ok bed. Plus self service laundry makes this little gem in nyc a rare find. Noisy as its literally next to rebuilding of the world trade center.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience..but yes, restaurant was a huge disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Sevilla90
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel June 24-26, 2011. Our experience overall was a positive one. In regard to the ratings, I agree it is "very good" but be sure to understand it is not a 4 star hotel. The "PROS": the property was very, very clean. There is filtered bottled water available on every floor which is great to take a few on the road it you day's travels. There is Wifi throughout the hotel and it is included in the price (and it was fast too!). The room had many plugs for electronic devices (which many hotels need to get with the times). The art/deco modern design and decor was pleasant. On the 20th +/- floor there is a beautiful outdoor view of the area i.e. the ground zero construction sites, the harbor, seaport etc. The staff was friendly and helpful. Guests can leave luggage on the 2nd floor in a monitored room for free...this was great for us in that we had 5 hours to roam the city with free hands after check out and before we had to leave the city. The area is a safe location. Starbucks is one block away. They have full digital cable channels=many selections. It was fairly easy to hail cabs from here, many times close to the front of the hotel. The CONS: The restaurant was a huge disappointment. I agree w/ what the other review says...we went up for Sunday breakfast buffet and stood in the doorway for a quite a while to just be acknowledged. While waiting we observed only 2 staff waiting frantically on a not-too-crowded place. when we were FINALLY seated but a not-so-friendly "manager" (super stressed out). We sat and WAITED some more. We are not unreasonable in that we expect to wait somewhat (normal)...but we got this "bad vibe" that the place was a cluster-**** and noticed that there were many customers waiting for bill etc. We ended up leaving after several more minutes w/o being acknowledged at all. Our time was precious in the city that day. What a huge disappointment though we waited to have a nice breakfast to end our stay there. For such a nice venue, and for being on the most busy day of the week SUNDAY, one would think they would have the staffing and service ready. I see that another review said they mandate a 18% tip. I would not pay that for such bad service...I am glad we left before we had to deal with that...and with a buffet which you wait on yourself? Ummm no. The other complaint: be prepared to WAIT a long time for the elevator...and it is stuffy, STUFF-Y! We did not have problems with noise from construction, but we were also placed at the opposite end of it. Foursquare peeps suggest to request to stay on opposite end of construction site. They are building 24/7 there. Overall, a good stay....at a HOTWIRE price...I would not pay full price for this place though. No bell hop, no pool, no room service (but restaurants deliver there), ..if you are expecting a four star hotel...this is not it. It is "very good" though.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly & affordable”
Reviews.Author: sbrooks1623
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't rate it four-star, but the hotel was VERY clean, secure, and offered a variety of amenities. The average room is very small, but the pillow, yes, the pillows, made it all worth it. Crews are currently working at Ground Zero around the clock, with work halting every night at approximately midnight. (The hotel offered a complimentary drink at their rooftop restaurant as a way of saying thanks whilst works are underway.) The location is great: the hotel is literally at Ground Zero, subway a block away, and locally-owned shops and cafes all around. It was really affordable, whilst everything up around Times Square was upwards of $250/night. (Another great tip: taxis and share rides know where the hotel is at! :)

Reviews.Title: “Love it in the beginning, but disappointed at their restaurant”
Reviews.Author: shihtingh
Reviews.Content: We booked the suite and we're lucky to get the room with view - stunning. The check-in line was long with only one man when we arrived, and long line at the elevators (one stayed at the 4th floor forever, and the other one wasn't fast and sufficient enough for all the people). The facilities are great especially for travelers with printer downstairs and free purified water on the go. The construction is going on during the day from 6am to 11pm, which is not their fault, and it's manageable with ear plugs. Our room somehow has cigarette smell, probably from previous guests. We ate our breakfast (supposed to be buffet 7-11am) 3 days in a row, and the third day at 9:45AM they said they couldn't serve buffet anymore but ala carte, so we ended up spending twice as much for the breakfast. The gratuity is always included as 18% in the bill no matter how bad their service is. The first day we walked up there for breakfast at 10am with almost every table in the mess and no available table to sit down. When we asked one of the bar waiter if he could clean the table, he claimed that the guy who supposed to do it was at room service. So we had to wait until this poor guy came back and clean the table - it was the same guy who seems to be the only one working really hard and suffer from all the inconvenience brought by their kitchen staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, convenient & a Manhattan bargain!”
Reviews.Author: PRGalIndiana
Reviews.Content: Had no noise issues . . . watching the Freedom Tower rise & the WTC Memorial take shape makes for a very inspiring view! Beautiful, exceptionally CLEAN room; friendly staff; very hospitable lobby with computers & other amenities. Arriving by taxi CAN be a bit tricky due to one-way streets and construction barricades, but NYC cabbies are quite inventive! Got a great rate booking directly online with hotel. Easy to get to midtown; walking distances to great breakfast diners, including one that was an aid station for 9/11 responders. Would go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Not that noisy, we had no trouble sleeping”
Reviews.Author: wellermdfan
Reviews.Content: There is a lot of construction going on outside but honestly, it never really bothered us at all. The hotel left a letter in our room apologizing for the noise and offering a free drink at their bar to compensate for it. We did not take advantage of that - we just weren't ever in the room except late at night to sleep until the following morning. I like staying downtown - there a many subway lines close by and I like the downtown atmosphere. We stayed here twice in the past month and each time the room was clean and rather large. Some rooms (like the one under us on the 14th floor) had a balcony with a little table and chairs. I didn't have any issues with the front desk staff but they are busy - there always seems to only be one person available regardless of how many people are waiting to checkin or checkout. Free wifi is a plus. I would stay here again if the price were right.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep, steer clear”
Reviews.Author: azlap
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine (though the staff were barely friendly) - it's the incessant (24 hours a day) from the noise of the WTC site that they don't tell you about. When a hotel employee asked me how my stay was, I said, 'You don't want to know" and politely told him about the noise. He couldn't have cared less, asked (sarcastically) if they should put it on their website. To which I answered, "Yes, when someone is paying $400 a night for a hotel they deserve to know if there is construction work going on 24 hours a day." The hotel is nice enough, though the extension phone did not work and there was no coffee in my room one day, but don't go near it if you like to sleep - at least not until the WTC site is rebuilt in late 2012. Poor service, high prices, incredible noise = steer clear."

Reviews.Title: “Lots of attitude from the front desk and hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta_student
Reviews.Content: This hotel is trying to sell itself as a 4-star hotel but it lacks some basic amenities. The hallways and corridors are so narrow at parts that luggage are not air conditioned, We were slapped with a whole bunch of taxes, charges that I have never seen in my various other stays in NYC. And to top it off the front desk is manned by a lady who is just plain rude (even by NY standards). This hotel is perfect only for backpackers who might otherwise be in a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel overlooking GROUND ZERO re-building--but, noisy in morning!!!”
Reviews.Author: FRANKRAFFA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated close to the Wall Street subway station. It is a new hotel that is attached to the Club Quarters hotel. The rooms are perfect, especially for the $105 HOWIRE price that I paid(minus fees). the lobby is pleasant with two FREE computers and a TV(not working at the time). The hotel has FREE INTERNET(a premium) which is not normal for most NYC hotels, but normal for any CLUB QUARTERS-related hotel. There is a separation form the CLUB QUARTERS section of the hotel, which is something novel. The website advertises free coffee all day in the lobby, but there was NONE. When I asked, I was told that it was only on the CLUB QUARTERS side. Hmmmmmm! The room was incredible.... totally electronic climate control on a little panel next to the bed. My room overlooked the 911 site which gives an incredible view of the construction. The bed was extremely comfortable with great pillows. The third floor(where I was) had vending, ice and an ATM. THE ONLY DRAWBACK was the lot jack-hammer noise around 6:30 A,M. It woke me right up and I was barely able to go back to sleep. I had wanted to sleep in, but........ The jewel was the 20th floor restaurant(open to all) that was open all day, with outdoor dining that was spectacular(if you could stand the construction noise). It is one of the best that I have seen. Overall, this is a great location for business in the downtown Wall Street area, but, unless you like subway travel(and the heat below ground is unbelievable), this is not close to major attractions, museums, Time Square, etc. However, for $105 for a **** hotel, I could not resist. frankraffa@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Fall asleep to jack hammers and construction, and pay a premium for it!”
Reviews.Author: mdh4276
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great for being in viewing distance of the World Trade Center construction site, unfortunately that closeness also includes listing to the TNT explosions and jack hammering of site preparation. The hotel provided no advance warning that the Superior room with View meant a view of a construction site and listening from 6:00 AM to 10:30 PM to construction sounds. Once we arrived to check-in we were provided with notice, unfortunately a bit late to make better reservations. We were accommodated with one room change reluctantly. The self service kiosks were also not working for check-in and at check-out had to use two of them.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: costa68
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days, and found everything to be more than satisfactory. The rooms are sleek, modern and very comfortable. We had an amazing view overlooking the WTC construction site, noise was not an issue. The filtered water stations on every floor are sooo convenient. We were always greeted by the front desk whether we werecoming or going. Multiple Subway stops are only a 3 minute walk away. We received an amazing price through priceline, not sure if we would pay full price to stay here though. Only negative was our room wasnt cleaned one day, but after notifying the front desk, we had towels and soap within 5 minutes, literally. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome couldn't have asked for better”
Reviews.Author: SkatersSkaters31
Reviews.Content: Excellent well equipped hotel, with friendly very helpful staff. Subway station is close by. There is noise from ground zero but once inside it is quiet. The view from the restaurant of the work going on at ground zero is very interesting, as are the cocktails!!!!!!!!! Would recommend this hotel as excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for your money!!!”
Reviews.Author: catelpa
Reviews.Content: I can't understand the negative comments that appear in the reviews for this hotel. My wife, daughter and I stayed there over the Easter long-weekend. On checking in, the staff greeting us were extremely courteous and helpful (and there was a tray of chocolate chip cookies). Although the kiosk check-in/check-out system may intimidate some people, the staff was there to offer assistance where required. Further, every time we entered the lobby from the elevator or upon our return from sightseeing, we were always greeted pleasantly by the staff. It rained like crazy for the majority of our visit, but the hotel offered up the use of umbrellas to protect us from getting wet. Nice touch. And our room!!! Compared to some of the dumps we've stayed at in mid-town that are $100 to $150 more expensive, this was by far the best value we've ever experienced. I can only comment about our room (a suite), but it was comfortable, extremely clean, with an outstanding view of the NYC skyline. The fridge, stove and oven were very handy in keeping us within our food budget. I can't comment on the restaurant as we didn't use it, but it seemed busy. The noise from the construction below is noticeable, but not overbearing. With the window closed, it could barely be heard. In fact, watching the construction of the historic re-build after the tragedy of 9/11 was quite moving and forever memorable. People complaining about the noise emanating from below should be ashamed. Access to the subways is unsurpassed ... the purchase of a 7 day unlimited-ride Metro pass eliminated the need for ever taking a taxi. All-in-all, a very pleasant place to stay. We're already planning a return visit this summer.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the rack rate”
Reviews.Author: raindr0p82
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through Hotwire and good thing I got a hefty discount because this place is not worth the rack rate. The hotel is band new, clean and modern (the rooms are tiny but functional). However, the staff is disinterested, unhelpful, unwelcoming and really soured the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Clean, New & Modern”
Reviews.Author: Tulene
Reviews.Content: I got a bargain on this hotel through priceline.com as my husband and I were staying a week in NYC and didn't want to pay the $250 + a night rates. What a lovely new, modern hotel located directly across the street from ground zero. The room we had was a standard room with a queen bed which was a good size and was new, clean and modern. The hotel is located very close to Wall Street and many subway stations. It is also just around the corner from Century 21 which is a super discount designer outlet that everyone should go to! This is the financial district in lower Manhattan and so it is about 20 to 25 mins on the subway up to Times Square.. that is the only downside to this hotel.. all the tourist stops are a short subway ride away. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and I would certainly stay here again. The noise from the construction at ground zero was not a problem either as it wasn't very loud and they only worked during the day (when we were out)

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the headache”
Reviews.Author: andregill001
Reviews.Content: First time to NYC and I choose this hotel because of the price...What a bad idea. First night, I get to the hotel and unload my luggage, I look around for a cart to put my clothes and bags on. The clerk at the desk, calls for a hotel member to help me with bags and he literally brings a DOLLY. Not what you would expect...Day two, 3:30am, I am awaken by my neighbors, who are playing the music so LOUD. When I call the front desk to complain, the hotel staff who arrived at my neighbor's door, Knocked several times and did not received an answer so had to use his own key to open the door. Around 8:30am as I was leaving my room for a meeting, I happen to see something protruding from underneath the bed. To my surprise, I found a load of linen sheets underneath my bed, I was not sure if they were clean or not, but really a load of laundry, C'mon Man!!!! Nevertheless I was HEATED!!! The same day, I get back to my room around 3:30pm and I stop by the front desk to speak with Hotel Operations Director David Garb. He does not answer his radio, so the clerk provides me with his business card. I go upstairs to my room to find my wonderful neighbors playing their music very loud once again. So I decide to call the manager to complain. As you guess it, NO answer. I decided to leave a brief message with my name and cell number. The interesting part is I still have not receive a phone call. So at this point I decided to take matters into my own hands, I went to the front desk and requested to change rooms, which they were more than happy to do. Overall I was not happy with my stay at this hotel. Next time I will definitely stay at the W Hotel or the Marriott which are right across the street from this hotel a little more in price but at least you know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Euro Style Modern at Great Value for NY”
Reviews.Author: sasha51
Reviews.Content: If you've been to Europe you will really appreciate this hotel. The rooms are quite small but complete with modern amenities in a very intelligent manner with very comfortable beds. So though not space, for NY this was a great value. Had some concern re noise from Ground Zero construction but as we were there only for the weekend had no problem at all. Very safe, with card key needed to access the elevator. Staff very helpful and overall had clean, modern lines to appreciate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: elisar
Reviews.Content: Rooms are fantastically equipped with all the amenities a traveler needs. Very clean new and pleasant staff. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Alot packed into a small space, clean, modern, with every thoughtful detail, even a laptop worklight.”
Reviews.Author: cburnside
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very secure. You need to insert your room key to even access the upper floors. The bedding was excellent quality, down pillows and comforter, and really soft. Tastefully decorated with high end finishes like granite in the bath and accent glass tile in the shower. The wardrobe and desk were matching and of great quality. The staff was nice and helpful, and even held onto my luggage all day for free after I checked out so I could still sight see before I picked up my car that night to go home. I was surprized of the luxury I recieved for the price I paid in New York city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money but avoid the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: janliz1953
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel - it was new, modern, clean and comfortable and very reasonably priced compared to other hotels in New York over New Year Had I not gone to the Restaurant it would have been a very successful stay BUT we did go - twice On the first day 30/12/10 I could not have a glass of wine as they had no corkscrew ! There was only one other couple eating when we were there. The food though was quite good On the last night 2/1/11 I ordered a coffee and asked that it be hot - topping it up with hot water if necesssary. I think she was more interested in her texting as she obviously did not listen to what I had said and my lukewarm/cold coffee arrived which was duly returned! I then foolishly ordered the soup - guess what that was cold as well I then left the restaurant and as i was leaving I said to the young guy at the desk that it was no suprise to me that the restaurant was empty. My lift took a while to come and I heard him repeating my comment to the other staff and they found this really amusing My friends stayed for a few more drinks and at 10pm an hour before the closing time the girl shouted last orders. Within minutes a large family party came in to eat and was about to be shown to their table when the girl stated that she had already closed and the people were asked to leave! The restaurant is advertised as open for food until 11pm

Reviews.Title: “If you want a good breakfast buffet, don't go to The World Center Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jvtraveler
Reviews.Content: Although we found the accommodations at The World Center Hotel in NYC, NY suitable, we were scratching our heads when we left their restaurant after breakfast. The hotel room provided a description of the breakfast menu for their restaurant and we thought it looked like a reasonable, convenient place to eat. When we arrived, we found the restaurant was only offering a buffet, not the menu found in the hotel room. The buffet was expensive, but we had planned our breakfast around meeting our train schedule; so we took the buffet at +$16.00 a person. There were only seven people in the restaurant the whole time we were there. The buffet was limited in selections: scrambled eggs, mini-pancakes, sausage/bacon, cereal, and juice. No fruit. You could have toast if you toasted it. Within minutes of our arrival, the buffet ran out of eggs. They were never replaced. The service was meager because it was a buffet. The waitress did bring us tea, coffee, and water; and she brought us the check which added a $6.00 TIP. We would not recommend The World Center Hotel restaurant if you stay down in the Financial District in NYC. It was overpriced, misleading, and poorly run. You are better off checking breakfast spots in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and New -- A fine place to lay your head”
Reviews.Author: Lansdalian
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the World Center Hotel. Got the room thru Priceline -- should have bid less -- but still feel fine with the rate I paid considering the time of the year/weekend. Took the train into Penn Station -- had lunch and took the 1 subway down to Chambers St. Just a short walk from there. The next morning took the 2 subway back up to Penn Station. Very easy. There is a Starbucks less than a block away at the Marriott. We dined in Brooklyn at Peter Luger's so this location meant only a $15 cab ride there. We found the hotel to be very convenient for our needs -- obviously new, and quite clean. We inspected the bed for bugs and found it to be clean. Our room was quite small but as the title says, it was a fine place to lay our heads Saturday night. Bathroom was nice but small. Strange thing about our room was our window looked out on a different room's balcony. Weird. All in all, we would stay here again and would recommend it to friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, efficient, economy lodging. Converted office building.”
Reviews.Author: sullja
Reviews.Content: In the midst of lower Manhattan construction zone. Floor to ceiling windows but mostly looking out on other high rise buildings. North side faces WTC construction zone.
