Rooms are very small and since it was converted from an office building, floors have narrow sinuous hallways to small rooms, often with a pillar or post in odd placement in the room. It was very clean, and spartan. Check-in was a breeze, just swipe your credit card at a kiosk, IF you knew what to do ahead of time. Initially they tried to put me in a broom closet room with no window within 6 feet of the floor, but I asked for a room higher up and got it. They did have free bottled water on each floor, a nice internet setup in the lobby and the complementary food looked decent though I didn't partake in it. It was a 5 minute walk to delis, Battery Park, Wall St., subways, etc. Definitely take the subway. A cab from Central Park took half an hour and $30. The subway as $2.25 and took 10 minutes. The top floor restaurant had a balcony looking out on the WTC construction site. My only complaint was the walls were thin. The young couple in the next room came in late and had an argument and then made up...both of which would have awakened the dead. 8-)

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean Hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe243
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in the Financial District just a few minutes walk from Wall Street. Concierges were very nice and helpful. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. I would recommend this hotel to everyone, who wants a clean and good-priced hotel in a secure and nice area. Ground Zero is exactly in front of the hotel, so during daytime it can be a bit loud, but you can sleep very well at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: skier1998
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. High standard of cleanliness. We stayed for 2 nights with our 2 1/2 year old and 7 month old. Bottled water on every floor. Touch screen for temperature control. Ipod docking station. Luggage storage. Check-in Kiosk. We would definitely stay again. It is conveniently located in the Financial district. Close to Wall St, Federal Hall, Trinity Church, Battery Park, Statue of Liberty, Ground Zero, and South Street Seaport. The only downside is that due to its location near Ground Zero - there is construction all around. It didn't bother us - as it wasn't noisy at all and we figured it kept foot / vehicle traffic low in the area. Awesome stay. We would definitely choose it again. Good bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for heart of NYC!”
Reviews.Author: dakotakidz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of renovation, but look out your window and you can watch Ground Zero rise with the new towers....while there were initial concerns online about noise, we were there on a weekend, and it wasn't a problem at all. In typical NYC fashion, the rooms were smaller, but new and clean and comfortable. We had everything we needed with TWO subway lines less than two blocks away, several coffee shops, markets, and places to get breakfast in the morning right outside the door. What a great place to duck in...walk to Battery Park, hop on a line and go anywhere from here!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: PennyRaven_Virginia
Reviews.Content: October the 4th thru the 9th GREAT hotel and Great staff close to subway. The staff was so good to us they greated us each time we came into the lobby we told them where we wanted to go they wrote down directions for us they even gave us there card and told us if we needed them to call,What hotel that you have stayed in would do that ? I even had a problem downloading some pictures to my computer they took the time out to help me twice they showed me what i was doing wrong .Great rooms with Great veiws I will tell everbody how great this place is .When i go back i will stay with World Center hotel it is a Great place to stay i loved it there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for New York vacation”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug073Toronto
Reviews.Content: The World Center Hotel provided a great base for a long weekend in New York. Yes, the rooms were a bit small and yes, the hotel was a bit pricey but that's New York for you. If you're looking for luxury and lots of amenities this is probably not the hotel for you. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant so I can't comment on the food. The lobby and rooms were fairly basic but the hotel is new and clean and in a good location. The hotel is located a few blocks away from several subway lines so getting around the city is very easy. Other people had complained in reviews about the noise but our room was facing east and we didn't hear any of the construction. The people at the front desk were helpful with any questions we had and we were able to store our luggage before and after checking in. Overall no complaints about our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: travelnics
Reviews.Content: the hotel had lovely facilities, the rooms were huge!! v clean and there was a self service check in and out. the location was lovely, not too far to commute to where it was all happening, but was a nice distance away from the hussle! ny is brilliant city to visit i recommend it to everyone with so much to see! there was nothing we didnt like about the hotel, the staff were helpfull and friendly too! would deff go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Something Different in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Hollinside
Reviews.Content: The World Center Hotel offers excellent accomodation and is unusual in as much as it is a Boutique Hotel and the service you would expect in a full service hotel is conspicuous by its absence. You virtually check yourself in and out using a computerised system which is very futuristic and although there are staff available I found them to be rather abrupt especially when asking questions. I got the impression that customer focus and accepted interaction with guests has been abandoned with the adoption of the computerised systems. However the hotel and rooms were very clean and functional with all the amenities you would expect in a Hotel operating at this level down to a micro wave oven in the rooms. The rooms are perhaps not the largest you will come across, however excellently appointed. The rooms do not have a bath, shower only. If I have a criticism of the rooms it is that the walls are paper thin, we had a young family next door to us and unfortunately were kept awake with a crying child. The restaurant on the 20th floor has an excellent outside seating area with unparralleled views over the ground zero site, which is directly below. The food in the restaurant is absolutely delicious and reasonably priced, the service in the restaurant is first class and definately a massive improvement on the reception area. The main entrance is tucked away around the corner from the main road which makes it difficult to hail a taxi especialy when loaded down with luggage etc. the lack of reception staff compounds the problem, so you have to be self sufficient securing your transport.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: MetroCity
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to New York for our birthdays. The staff was not very helpful initially (borderline rude). We had to address a concern with management when we got there about the complimentary breakfast. After that issue was addressed, and the situation resolved, our stay wasn't that bad. One major complaint was that the elevator stinked, no matter what time you got on. There was a pungent smell, as if it were in the walls due to bad ventilation. The price isn't bad, but I believe when they finish renovating, it will be similar in price, as their competition.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, new building, huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: Joemadi
Reviews.Content: The first problem was noise coming from WTC works, but we were transferred to a another suite with a balcony, The second was parking at 40$ a night for a SUV... We spent 4 nights here during our 2 month USA tour with 3 kids, we liked the hotel luxury and the room/suite size: impressive for NYC!!! Everything is new and clean here, we were close to Battery park, the Hudson river, Tribeca, and of course the Financial district and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: favfamily
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel that offers spacious rooms, very nicely decorated. The staff is excellent, Kevin at the front desk was very helpful and couldn't do enough for us, just for this reason I would return and stay again. It is difficult to find a hotel with a large enough room to sleep 2 adults and 2 teenagers but with a fold out sofa bed, a rollaway and a full size queen bed it was fine. We also had a small kitchen, 2 closets, a flat screen TV. The ipod dock was great for recharging the ipods(the teens were happy). Overall this is a great value for New York City, great service and very comfortable, spotless rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Best value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: wtracing
Reviews.Content: We got a room at this hotel through a discount hotel broker and couldn't have been more pleased. First off - this hotel is generally called "Club Quarters World Trade Center" on travel sites, but it appears that unless you are a Club Quarters member, you actually stay at the "World Center Hotel" which is all in the same building, but have different sets of front doors. This hotel was hands down a great value in NYC. We got this room for about $150 a night plus tax. The location is a little sleepy on weekends, but is safe and easy to get to (multiple train lines - 1, R, 6, and I believe the A C or E all service this general area,). The room was small, but was well appointed. Sadly, we were on the 16th floor, but the room only provided a window into a neighboring building - but the views from this hotel could be gorgeous depending on which room you get. Service was okay upon check in. We arrived well before check-in began, and it is their policy to take your bags and then have them in your room for you when you do come to check in later. Check in is done through computers in the lobby, which seems to work well (Beware, when you check in the card you use in the machine will be debited $90.00 for incidentals - I had planned to use a different card for that, but the machine does not tell you before it charges the incidentals). When checking out, we left our bags with the front desk to pick up later. When we returned to pick up our bags before departing the city, it took approximately 20 minutes to get them (it appears they store them on an upper floor) - so beware that it may not be lightning fast! The free water bottles in the hallway is really nice touch and very helpful (and saves money buying bottles from street vendors or shops!). The bed was comfortable and we slept well. The biggest downside for me to this hotel is the SHOWER. Our shower (and we had a handicap accessible shower, so perhaps it is different from others in the hotel) consisted of a 1 inch tall gray plastic wall around the floor and a shower curtain. While it looks innovative, etc. it is very easy to get water everywhere on the floor. They really should have built these showers differently. Also, the water pressure was quite low on the 16th floor. Overall, a great stay. You can't beat it for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: westmc9th
Reviews.Content: The view was nice the hotel food was a little over priced my only complaint is that they did not have the hotel room cooled off at all it was 89 in the room and that the toilet was plugegd otherwise very ncie stay

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Suite”
Reviews.Author: LarissaCT
Reviews.Content: We booked World Center Hotel on Priceline's Name Your Own Price. I bid $150 and then had to pay taxes of $40. We got a standard room but upgraded for $25 to a suite since there were three of us. The suite was wonderful - plenty of closet space, two tv's, a kitchenette, and interesting views. I say that because you are overlooking the construction of the new Freedom Towers. It's definitely a little surreal to stand above the site of the Twin Towers. The drilling started at 7:30 in the morning but that wasn't an issue for us since we wanted to get up and start the day. Obviously this will be even less of a problem as the new towers are built. We parked in a garage right around the corner for $32/day - a good price for Manhattan. Careful if you're using a navigation system - my friend punched in the address as New York, NY and it took us to Washington Street in Brooklyn instead. I thought the staff was very attentive and helpful. If the hallway guest closets do not have what you need they wil happily bring it to your room. The hotel is very clean and modern. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If it weren't for the staff, it would have been perfect”
Reviews.Author: EdgeofExistence
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews, I thought we could bypass the staff altogether and attempt to check-in via the computer kiosks. It said "Room not ready, please ask for assistance." The staff member told us our room would be ready in 5 minutes, then he disappeared and we did not see him again. 20 minutes later, when we asked another staff member about our room status, he replied "I don't know" and did not offer to check for us. It took us being a bit proactive in asking about our room in order for someone to get back to us, but 30ish minutes later, we were finally called back and given a key to our room. The room itself is lovely - simple, small, clean. It is quiet and has all the amenities you could need, including a small flat screen tv, hairdryer, closet, toiletries. The shower does not have a bath, but it is a large stand-up stall which I thought was fabulous. The location of the hotel is great - next to a dead end corner which, I think, might add to the quietness factor. On the other hand, it is so centrally-located that it is a perfect spot from which to launch into your NY exploration. I would, however, recommend doing your homework...my "let's wing it" approach to finding this hotel wasn't successful, and strangely enough, three out of four cab drivers did not know where Albany street was. For the price I paid, I would certainly go here again, with hopes for the same nice quality of room and hopes for a better interaction with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: PolarBear777
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline, and were happy with this hotel. It is very new with some unique touches. Good -Free coffee in the lobby, and free water bottles on each floor -Closet on each floor for frequently requested items (though it was missing items that would commonly be needed such as toiletries) -Well-designed rooms -Staff was kind, especially in storing all of our luggage without hassle or fees -Free internet Bad -Rooms are a bit small -Location is right near WTC site, so there is construction (but no noise) and the area is not very lively Overall, a nice hotel. Seems well suited for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Crisp and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: wme79736
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is clean, crisp and comfortable. It has an excellent gym and the rooms have a large business desk with plenty of power outlets and space for computers, phones, rechargers, cables, brief case, papers etc. The closets are large, the bathroom is spacious and well appointed and the bed and furnishings were extremely comfortable and pleasant. The hotel is quiet and secluded even though it is in the centre of the financial district right next to the crater where once the World Trade Center stood. There was no restaurant open during my stay in March 2010 but the hotel provided a complimentary continental breakfast which I did not want but which appeared to be generous and satisfactory. Wholefoods and many excellent bars, diners and restaurants were located within a five to ten minute walk away. I would never have thought of Wall Street as a "Nite Spot" I was astonished by the number of bars and restaurants (all looking sad and empty) which remained open until after midnight in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. The river and Battery Park are literally across the street and the Century 21 discount department store is three city blocks away. I booked my room on a â€œno namesâ€� hotel discount website and paid just over $100. At this sort of reduced rate The World Center is an excellent deal in terms of location, comfort and amenities. The hotel advertises on the major discount hotel sites too. Because it is an apartment hotel, without the usual facilities, some discount websites describe it as a three and a half star hotel in the Downtown/Soho area, but the rooms themselves rate more than 4 stars and the full-price â€œrack rateâ€� reflects this. As with so many hotels in New York the front desk staff was indifferent and unhelpful. This hardly mattered because checking in and out is an automated process, rendering most of the front deskâ€™s role redundant, but it was annoying and inconvenient when phone calls were not put through and messages were not delivered.

Reviews.Title: “It was a wonderful hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: JoyLiChang
Reviews.Content: There service was always so professional and sweet. My colleague and I stayed for 7 days and each everyday was a treat to go in and out of the hotel. We love our rooftop dinner every night. We will bring our own carryout and ice cream to there to eat and to enjoy the beautiful night view on the rooftop. There are tables, chairs and even flowers over there. We stayed in there city studio and it has a kitchen with everything we need to make our own luxury dinner at the rooftop. It was great stay with great price. Great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quite a horrible Honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: sctrudeau
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were taking a quick honeymoon in the city but couldnt find a hotel for the last night of our trip, so we booked World Center. We came across MANY problems. 2 twin beds pushed next to eachother is apparently a King sized Bed (with the crease down the middle, great for newly weds). Beds are HARD AS CEMENT, maybe some people like that. No hair dryer No iron/ironing board No mini fridge No morning newspaper No continential breakfast (as they advertised) Ikea furnishing (and the quality that comes along with it) Broken coffee pot (arent you a NEW hotel?!?) The AC was stuck at 60 degrees, the room had no extra blankets. We called for some and they never arrived. No concierge, no one to call a cab for us-because no cabs will go down the one-way alley to pick you up or drop you off Spotty internet connection that the front desk denied because they hadnt recieved any other complaints. When we went to check in, the lady acted like she was checking us in at the front desk, only to then walk us over to the self check-in. What was she doing for 3 minutes?? This happened again when checking out. It also took the guy 15 minutes to find our bags. They couldnt find a band-aid when I stubbed my toe on the construction they were doing. No apologies, apparently it was my fault for stepping on something to exit the elevator Oh yeah, and I mysteriously got a huge bug bite on my hand.... could have been the tiny bugs all over the lobby. For Pros, It was quiet, except when we opened the window to warm the room up a bit. Bottled water machines in the hallways Some people may prefer hard beds with tiny pillows

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: amunzenberger
Reviews.Content: We really liked our stay at the World Center hotel and would definitely stay again. The hotel has a boutique feel to it and every staff member with whom we interacted was friendly and helpful. Although the room was small, it was very functional and modern with its design. There was a nice flat screen TV mounted to the wall over the desk. The bed was Very comfortable. The room was very clean (and I am extremely picky about that). One thing we thought was very cool was that the "communal" self-service closet on each floor from which you could get an iron, extra blankets, pillows, etc. rather than stocking every room with these things. We thought this was a very forward-thinking idea! Another nice amenity was the purified water with empty water bottles on the floor... you could get a bottle and fill up anytime you wanted for free. The hotel is still under construction and every once in a while the work above us would cause the ceiling in our bathroom to rattle, but if we closed the bathroom door it wouldn't bother us. We got a great rate thru Hotwire, so that made up for the minor annoyance. The bathroom had a shower stall (no tub if you prefer baths) and the shower head had a bit of a weak flow, but it wasn't too bad... just took a little bit longer to get the shampoo out. The hotel is still offering a free breakfast due to the ongoing construction, but we always slept in too late and never actually made it up there. Check-in and check-out was a breeze... this can also be self-service... they have three computers setup for this in the lobby. The front desk staff was so helpful and friendly, though that I never got all the way through the process... they just stepped in and did it all for me. We thought the location was great for spending time in Lower Manhattan. The hotel is a short walk from Battery Park and right around the corner from Wall Street. We also walked to TriBeCa, SoHo, Greenwich/West Village, Chinatown, Little Italy, and the Brooklyn Bridge from the hotel. If the weather is nice, you want some exercise, and you are spending most of your time in this area you may as well walk because we never found one cab driver that knew where the hotel is located. It doesn't help that the entire area is under construction so it can be very difficult for the cabbies to actually get around the streets near the hotel. It really wasn't a problem for us, though... the few times we took cabs, we just had them drop us off a couple of blocks away and walked the rest. You can always catch a cab very easily from West Rd, which is only a block away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCJUNKIE2
Reviews.Content: Great clean, new hotel. Nice and quiet place to unwind. Loved the self service closet for extra pillows, blankets, etc. Never heard any construction noise at all. Taxi drivers still don't know where it is located, so make sure you know the cross streets to tell them. Northwest corner of Albany and Washington. Beds are super comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Best value--great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrySei22
Reviews.Content: I found this classified as a 3 1/2 star on Hotwire. With a price tag of about $120/night, I was scared this might be too good to be true. It wasn't! I echo all the other reviews about cleanliness and how nice the amenities are. I didn't hear any construction noise, even though my room faced the construction. I was the envy of all my fellow conference attenders last week when they told me they paid $250+ to stay in dumpy old hotels by NYU. As long as they keep selling rooms for less than $200 a night, the World Center Hotel will still be a steal. I highly recommend it!
